questions.question: Are the eyes of the figurine dark brown in color?
questions.explanation: In Image B, the material and visual depiction make it challenging to distinctly identify eye color, as it blends with the monochromatic texture of vanilla/off-white coloring. Therefore, it is not accurate to describe the eyes as dark brown based purely on visual cues in Image B.

questions.question: Is the nose of the figurine black and oval-shaped?
questions.explanation: In Image B, the nose is not visible due to the blurred area covering the entire face region. Without a visible nose element, it's impossible to determine its color or shape.

questions.question: Does the figurine retain the white, curly fur in a poodle-style grooming pattern?
questions.explanation: Image B presents a figure with white, curly hair resembling a popular poodle-style groomed fur. The depiction in Image B showcases a similar hairstyle sans detailed color shifts, maintaining the visual portrayal of poodle-styled hair.

questions.question: Are there large, layered pink ruffles on both sides of the figurineâ€™s dress?

questions.question: Is there a detailed silver brooch located at the center of the chest area of the dress?
questions.explanation: Image B, due to its sculptural nature, lacks any color distinctions. There is no visible silver brooch; the surface detailing is uniform in the presented style.

questions.question: Is the figurine in a side profile pose with the head turned slightly forward?
questions.explanation: The figurine in Image B is positioned facing forward, suggesting a straightforward display within the arch, as opposed to any side profile or turning.

questions.question: Does the dress maintain a pastel color scheme with light blue and pink hues?
questions.explanation: Image B illustrates the dress in an intricately carved form, stripped of all color attributes, resulting in an overall vanilla/off-white appearance instead of pastel hues.
